item.title: Microsoft Outlook to block more risky attachments used in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft announced it will expand the list of blocked attachments in Outlook Web and the new Outlook for Windows starting next month. [...]

item.title: Texas Dept. of Transportation breached, 300k crash records stolen
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Texas Department of Transportation (TxDOT) is warning that it suffered a data breach after a threat actor downloaded 300,000 crash records from its database. [...]

item.title: FIN6 hackers pose as job seekers to backdoor recruiters’ devices
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: In a twist on typical hiring-related social engineering attacks, the FIN6 hacking group impersonates job seekers to target recruiters, using convincing resumes and phishing sites to deliver malware. [...]

item.title: Ivanti Workspace Control hardcoded key flaws expose SQL credentials
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Ivanti has released security updates to fix three high-severity hardcoded key vulnerabilities in the company's Workspace Control (IWC) solution. [...]

item.title: Massive Heroku outage impacts web platforms worldwide
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Heroku is suffering a widespread outage that has lasted over six hours, preventing developers from logging into the platform and breaking website functionality. [...]

item.title: AI is a data-breach time bomb, reveals new report
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Varonis
item.description: AI acts like Pac-Man—devouring sensitive data across clouds, apps, and copilots. Varonis analyzed 1,000 orgs and found 99% have exposed data AI can access, exposing them to data risks. [...]

item.title: OpenAI working to fix ChatGPT outage affecting users worldwide
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: OpenAI is working to fix an ongoing outage impacting ChatGPT users worldwide and preventing them from accessing the chatbot on the web or via mobile and desktop apps. [...]

item.title: Five plead guilty to laundering $36 million stolen in investment scams
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Five men from China, the United States, and Turkey pleaded guilty to their involvement in an international crime ring and laundering nearly $37 million stolen from U.S. victims in cryptocurrency investment scams carried out from Cambodia. [...]

item.title: Stolen Ticketmaster data from Snowflake attacks briefly for sale again
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The Arkana Security extortion gang briefly listed over the weekend what appeared to be newly stolen Ticketmaster data but is instead the data stolen during the 2024 Snowflake data theft attacks. [...]

item.title: Over 84,000 Roundcube instances vulnerable to actively exploited flaw
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Over 84,000 instances of the Roundcube webmail software are vulnerable to CVE-2025-49113, a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability with a publicly available exploit. [...]

item.title: Google patched bug leaking phone numbers tied to accounts
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A vulnerability allowed researchers to brute-force any Google account's recovery phone number simply by knowing a their profile name and an easily retrieved partial phone number, creating a massive risk for phishing and SIM-swapping attacks. [...]

item.title: SentinelOne shares new details on China-linked breach attempt
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: SentinelOne has shared more details on an attempted supply chain attack by Chinese hackers through an IT services and logistics firm that manages hardware logistics for the cybersecurity firm. [...]

item.title: Linux Foundation unveils decentralized WordPress plugin manager
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A collective of former WordPress developers and contributors backed by the Linux Foundation has launched the FAIR Package Manager, a new and independent distribution system for trusted WordPress plugins and themes. [...]

item.title: Sensata Technologies says personal data stolen by ransomware gang
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Sensata Technologies is warning former and current employees it suffered a data breach after concluding an investigation into an April ransomware attack. [...]
